UML:TaggedValue.value: Folder structure 00- Example Applications Pool: Contains all the apps that have been to voting.

This is where we put all the services that have been identified and regarded to be interesting. The flagship scenario will be about one of these services. There rest of the services are kep for future versions of flagship scenario.
The current flagship scenario is labeled "Current" in its title.

This is where we put all the services that have been identified and regarded to be interesting. The flagship scenario will be about one of these services. There rest of the services are kep for future versions of flagship scenario.
The current flagship scenario is labeled "Current" in its title.

EAScenario.name: 00- Example App functionality description
EAScenario.description:
Short description
Functionality
Z registers to
Main concern of WP3: Web 1.0 or Web 2.0
Feedback between developers and users. Interactions between them
uStore creates on-demand deploy package for users.
Service providers will need one-to-one interaction with their users, services are provided individually Developers will need to have a bit more aggregated view on the problems with their software
John: Developer John registers to developer depot and uStore (possibly registeres only to one portal). John registers as an individual user to uStore (with possibility to upgrade to an organization later) There will be a networked model
Mary: Service provider Mary registers to uStore. Single login and single entry point for all roles. Cases where one service provider is aggregating software and services from other actors. Allowing end users to take on the role of service provider and stitching together a complicated service. Both models of downloading applications and subscribing to services Link to downloading applications or getting in contact with service providers Developers can develop their services in other places than in developer depot and store it to uStore.
EAScenario.subject: EAPK_5CB69CE2_A46F_4e02_8811_E07A47574FF3

EAScenario.name: 00- Main characters acting in the scenario
EAScenario.description: Sauron: Sauron is a newcomer to Shire. He has this business idea that he can set up an online store and create a marketplace for AAL services. He sees this opportunity to bring together all the other characters (below) into meeting each other in his online store called uStore. Bilbo Baggins is an old man, 80 years old, who will receive the benefits of services provided by Sauron's universAAL.org. Frodo Baggins is Bilbo's nephew. He helps Bilbo and is Bilbo's only next of kin living in Shire. Gandalf is a programmer at WizSoft Ltd. who is informed by Saruman, his boss and CEO of WizSoft, that a new web site is up called universAAL. Aragorn is the mayor of Shire and is responsible for public AAL services to Shire elderly. Legolas is his start performer home care nurse. Gimli is a private service provider. He buys software from WizSoft for his home alarm systems, and provides these alarms both to Shire municipality and in the private market in Shire. Denethor is the representative of Middle-Earth public pension and insurances in Shire. He is in charge of paying for AAL services that are provided to the elderly in Shire. The Witch King of Angmar (The king) is the representative of the Middle-Earth authorities. In charge of making sure AAL services to Shire elderly comply to Middle-Earth standards. Gollum is a hacker. He is Bilbo's neighbour and tries all the time to break into Bilbo's wireless network and do damages or read private information. General practitioner?
EAScenario.subject: EAPK_5CB69CE2_A46F_4e02_8811_E07A47574FF3

EAScenario.name: 10- Setting up uStore and developer depot
EAScenario.description:
Sauron has observed the aging population of Shire and has identified business opportunities in providing an arena for the exchange of AAL services in Shire. He has hired a group of researchers from another universe (called universAAL) to build software for his market place.
Sauron is told by the universAAL team that one of the major competitive advantages of uStore is that it is closely integrated with something called Developer Depot (DD). This means that developers can be in close contact with users, and can integrate user feedback into new versions of their services.
<u>Open issue</u>: Conceptually, uStore and Developer Depot need to have different operator roles. Here Sauron will either takes on both of the roles or we introduce a new character as DD operator. Two separate scenarios are created for setting up uStore and DD.
The following 1X scenarios show how each of uStore and DD are set up.
EAScenario.subject: EAPK_5CB69CE2_A46F_4e02_8811_E07A47574FF3

EAScenario.name: 11- Setting up uStore
EAScenario.description: Actors: Sauron This scenarios should describe what Sauron does in order to set up a uStore. - Does he have to download uStore software from a server and install it? Idea: Why not have uStore software downloaded from DD? - Does he buy a uStore service from a meta-operator, a uStore hotel? - Does he need to get approval from The Witch king of Angmar? - How does he connect to Denethor? Denethor is interesting in tracking service usage in order to know what to reimburse. - How does he install the software? What basic infrastructure does he need? - How does he connect to Developer Depot? - Will uStore have any marketing facilities? Towards Bilbo, Frodo, Gandalf, etc.?
EAScenario.subject: EAPK_5CB69CE2_A46F_4e02_8811_E07A47574FF3

EAScenario.name: 15- Setting up Developer Depot
EAScenario.description: Actors: Sauron, or someone else (a DD operator). - Will we distinguish between Sauron and a developer depot operator? E.g. Apple runs AppStore but many of the applications in AppStore are developed on Sourceforge. - Many of the same questions asked in Setting up uStore apply also here.
EAScenario.subject: EAPK_5CB69CE2_A46F_4e02_8811_E07A47574FF3

EAScenario.name: 17- Connecting uStore and Developer Depot together
EAScenario.description:
Actors: uStore and DD operators (Sauron and Sauron?) Open issue: We need to be clear about the value in connecting DD and uStore.
  • We have discussed at least one topic which is allowing developers collect feedback from users, but this can also be a mechanism that allows downloaded code talk directly to DD. No uStore needed in between.
  • Another value is that if Gandalf registers to DD he has the option of automatically registering to uStore in a developer role. But this is also something that can be done in the Eclipse tools and does not need to involve DD.
We need to specify how the two are connected. In a real life scenario we should distinguish between a uStore operator and a DD operator. See the open issue below. Open issue: Will the connections be 1-1 og N-N? Can a uStore be connected to many DDs and vice versa? In my (Babak's) opinion yes. Gandalf wants to use one DD for development but many uStores for uploading his code. Sauron wants to operate one uStore but possibly allow integration with many DDs. A programmer like Gandalf will most probably register to one DD, while he might register to many uStores for selling his code.
EAScenario.subject: EAPK_5CB69CE2_A46F_4e02_8811_E07A47574FF3

step.name: A programmer like Gandalf will most probably register to one DD

EAScenario.name: 20- Signing up as users of uStore and developer depot
EAScenario.description: The following 2X scenarios describe how registration process is done and who is involved.
EAScenario.subject: EAPK_5CB69CE2_A46F_4e02_8811_E07A47574FF3

EAScenario.name: 21- Signing up to uStore
EAScenario.description:
Actors: Bilbo (is the elderly), Frodo (is the next of kin), Gandalf (wants to upload code), Aragorn (wants to provide services), Legalos (wants to help Bilbo), Denethor (wants to pay for reimbursable services), The king (wants to monitor) Open issue: We have discussed the process of signing up and there are two main alternatives coming up related to the role:
  1. A user specifies role before registration.
    1. Advantage: possibly simpler implementation of uStore.
    2. Disadvantages: users with multiple roles need to register multiple times.
  1. A user specifies role after registration, in a list where he/she clicks for the roles he/she wants to play
    1. Advantages: flexible, users can take on different or multiple roles that can change over time.
    2. Disadvantages: ??
To be added: We need to specify how each of the roles above can be registered, i.e. how an elderly, a next of kin, a service provider, a programmer can register. Service provider: Aragorn has heard about uAAL and the new uStore through the local orcs. He contacts Sauron who advises him to register to uStore and indicate he is a major service provider in Shire. Aragorn goes to the uStore web site and registered. Checks for service provider, with 1000+ working for him. He also registers Shire municipality as the legal entity providing the services. Aragorn asks Legolas to register as service provider and select "Employee of Shire municipality".
EAScenario.subject: EAPK_5CB69CE2_A46F_4e02_8811_E07A47574FF3

EAScenario.name: 25- Signing up to Developer Depot
EAScenario.description:
Actors: Gandalf and possibly Saruman (Saruman if we want to support company visibility in DD in addition to supporting freelance programmers). Sauron or DD operator needs to approve. Gandalf goes to DD and selects register user Gandalf fills inn information about himself Gandalf fills in information about WizSoft Ltd. Open issue: Do we need an institutional user here? In general there might be a need to have some entity in uStore and DD with legal responsibility. Please review the following. Relates to number 17 above. Gandalf fills in information about which uStores he will use to upload his code. A list of registered uStores is provided for selection. Gandalf does not have user on any uStore so DD registration process asks whether a user should be created. After registration Gandalf receives a confirmation email and confirms Open issue: Should we have some central approval option for the DD operator? Open issue: What role will Gandalf have in the uStores he selects in the list above? Maybe a service provider role? The opening page of DD after registration is finished should show:
  • Some links to help sections
  • Link to Eclipse tools from WP3 to download. Possibly a link to a packaged Eclipse distribution.
  • Link to projects that Gandalf has created (currently none).
  • Overview of messages from e.g. users, service providers, other developers...
  • Link to uStores Gandalf is registered at.
EAScenario.subject: EAPK_5CB69CE2_A46F_4e02_8811_E07A47574FF3

EAScenario.name: 26- Downloading Eclipse tools from Developer Depot
EAScenario.description:
Actor: Gandalf On the DD portal page there is a link to development tools. Gandalf clicks on this link and a new page showing a list of links shows up.
  • Option 1: Gandalf has Eclipse installed. He can click on a link and download uAAL features from the web page to his hard disk.
  • Option 2: Gandalf gets a link to uAAL update site for Eclipse, opens Eclipse and adds this to Eclipse update sites. Then he searches for universAAL and finds the features that are then installed.
  • Option 3: Gandalf does not have Eclipse installed. He downloads a uAAL distribution of Eclipse from the site.
EAScenario.subject: EAPK_5CB69CE2_A46F_4e02_8811_E07A47574FF3

EAScenario.name: 30- Adding new sevices to uStore
EAScenario.description:
Gandalf registers to uStore
uStore has conformance testing for new applications that are uploaded. Compliance with uAAL
Tools in eclipse need to interface to both depot and ustore
- Gandalf registers as user of uStore, possibly clicks for "I am a developer" - Forwarded to developer depot
- One or few depots, while one ustore for each market. Relations between these two needs to be identified. - Where are user profiles of Gandalf stored?
- Confirm email is sent to Gandalf. - Link to eclipse feature set for uAAL is provided (email or on web page). - Link to other more basic methods (in case the developer is not interested in our tools. Note: This step has low priority) - Links are provided to 1) eclipse web site (if the developer does not have eclipse installed), and 2) link to uAAL eclipse update site. - Install uAAL studio where Gandalf is asked for which features to install + restart. - This means a set of features: 1) Dev depot client, 2) uStore client, 3) modelling support, 4) Process support dashboard, 5) a set of wizards for each feature, 6) personalization support, 7) build support. - Each feature has a help button to show what each feature is and why it is needed (or not needed) - Gandalf checks all features and installs them. - Gandalf restarts eclipse. -
EAScenario.subject: EAPK_5CB69CE2_A46F_4e02_8811_E07A47574FF3
